meanings.definition: Originating or produced outside of an organism or system.
meanings.sent1: The exogenously grown plants were thriving in the greenhouse.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the exogenously sourced materials under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The exogenously delivered pizza arrived just in time for the party.
meanings.sent4: Her exogenously acquired skills in painting shone through in her artwork.
meanings.sent5: The exogenously introduced species disrupted the local ecosystem.

meanings.definition: Influenced or caused by external factors.
meanings.sent1: The exogenously triggered reaction surprised the researchers.
meanings.sent2: The economy's growth was exogenously driven by global market trends.
meanings.sent3: The exogenously changing weather kept everyone on their toes.
meanings.sent4: His exogenously altered mood affected the entire team's morale.
meanings.sent5: The exogenously imposed regulations impacted businesses across the board.
